activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tera J. Powell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
May do CS for entire amount due
Must submit DNA sample at Sheriff's Dept

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 3:06 p.m. Defendant Tera J. Powell in court.  Court questions defendant as to non-payment and community service performed. Defendant states she was informed that she could perform community service in Langlade County until she spoke to JA who informed her it had to be done in Oneida County. Defendant states she has made $150 payment. If defendant can provide non-profit agency in Langlande County that will allow community service - Court will allow - Defendant needs to obtain prior approval of agency for community service. Adj. 3:12 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Tera J. Powell
Current: W6107 East Walleye Lane, Pearson, WI 54462   (Effective: 04-24-2015)
Prior: N10540 E. Shore Road, Pearson, WI 54462

Defendant Tera J. Powell in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:49
Bednar/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing - 
Court imposes fine /costs totalling $579 ($379 plus $200 DNA surcharge - ) May do CS at rate of $10/hr for entire amount - Defendant must also report to Oneida County jail to submit DNA sample within 48 hours  -  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Appeal rights given  Review hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

02:25 pm - Defendant Tera J. Powell in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Bednar/Voorhees/Court statement to sentencing.  Court adjourns for sentencing to allow defendant time to complete the Last Chance Program.  Bail continued.  
Adjourned 02:45 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
May not be on any Shopko premises - Submit to Booking within 24 hours

02:50 pm - Defendant Tera J. Powell in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea.  Bednar/Voorhees to bond.  Court sets sig bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:19
No appearance by defendant - Voorhees statement to non appearance - request adj - 
Court grants  Initial appearance scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
